text: Dark beer with foamy beige head. Wonderful coffee maple nose. This is like drinking a donut. Rich maple flavor with lots of coffee, a bit of smoke, and raw brown sugar. Milk chocolate and vanilla. Lots of flavors and very big.

A: coffee, syrup, sweet chocolate, and toffee
A: dark Brown, almost black, tanned head
T: dark Malts, maple syrup, coffee, chocolate, smokey touch. Not too much of the salty bacon
P: soy-ish, not thick, and a cacao aftertaste lacking bitterness

Great beer, so fun to drink! A bit too soy-y, only downside of the beer considering the style
From tap. A black beer with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, maple syrup, coffee and alcohol.

Bottle. Pours jet black with a small, creamy light brown head. Aroma is heavily maple with coffee and roasted malt. Somewhat sweet flavor with a touch of smoke, a bit of saltiness, and roasted coffee beans. Full bodied and creamy on the palate with lingering roasted coffee. Very good.
Draft. Pours dark black. The aroma smells like breakfast. Maple and chocolate. The palate is creamy. The taste is maple sweet with coffee. Solid beer.

Bottle, courtesy of Meilby. Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma of maple wood, some roasted notes, coffee and chocolate. Flavor is sweet and malty with some warming alcohol, maple, chocolate and caramel. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 650ml @ geokkjer
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, cocoa, vanilla, chocolate, coffee, maple syrup and brown sugar. Taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long roasted, cocoa, vanilla, coffee and chocolate finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle, 22oz. Close to black in the glass, with a dense, finger thick light tan head. Nutty aroma with lots of roasted malts and heavy caramel. Coffee, chocolate and brown sugar. ItÂ’s full bodied, sticky sweet and smooth on the palate, with a sweet flavor of dark caramel sauce, nuts and roasted malts. Coffee and chocolate. Lasting sweet, nutty finish with coffee and chocolate. Delicious. Too sweet, but delicious. 170516

Dark brown pour with mocha lacing. Smells strongly of slightly salted maple syrup, slight caramel, slight toffee sweetness, mild roasted coffee on the backend that you have to search for. The taste is more coffee forward than the smell, with the maple component taking a back seat. The maple component is light on the palate, but is accompanied with notes of mild smoke and slight leather. A malt component presents midway through, getting slightly stronger as the beer warms up. The 9.5% ABV presents as / covered by a roast bitterness, but does not overstay or overextend its welcome. The smell is definitely akin to the base MBCP beer, but the taste has a stronger coffee/bitter component to it. The mouthfeel is a bit creamier and noticeably heavier than it's base counterpart. Overall, it's a great brew, but I may actually prefer the base beer for these adjuncts, as the taste is too roast-heavy, which is necessary to cover up the increased ABV. And no, you can't compare this to Morning Wood, it's Barrel-aged big brother, as the barreling adds complexity along with oak and 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at the Lamb. Pours black with a thick dark tan head. Bacon, maple syrup, chocolate coffee and roasted grain aroma. Thick body with syrup, chocolate coffee roasted grain and some burnt bacon taste. Damn.

2016 22 oz bottle. Pours nearly black in color and topped by a small layer of tan colored foam that shows good retention before slowly settling to a thin film and leaving streaks of lace on the glass. The aroma is amazing showing notes of fresh maple syrup, roasted coffee, chocolate, mocha, vanilla, and some smoked malts to go with the dark caramel and roasted malts. The flavor follows suit and shows a nice mix of all the flavors with the rich maple syrup, roasted coffee, milk chocolate, mocha, vanilla, and salty smokey bacon all playing a key role. There is just enough roast in there to add some balancing bitterness while the malts add a touch of smoothness. Full bodied and smooth with balanced carbonation that leads to a lengthy maple syrup and roasted coffee finish. No hint of alcohol at all in this one. The base imperial porter lends itself perfectly to all the additions. An outstanding beer that never disappoints and takes MBCP to a whole other level. Awesome stuff here.

duft. sÃ¸d karamel chokolade karamle kaffe vanilje.
smag: ristet malt sÃ¸d vanilje malt karamel ristet kant

Pours opaque coffee brown with a serviceable tan head. Aroma delivers maple syrup, roast malt, coffee and molasses tones. Flavor is breakfast in a bottle - coffee, maple syrup, roast malt, molasses, sweet but not cloying. Mouthfeel offers thick body and lively fizz. One sip and youÂ’ll be wide awake. Too much, and--

Bottle @home. Black colour with light brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, smoke, lots of maple syrup. Taste is similar but it has bit more kick to it than the original, more bitterness, which is nice! All in all a freaking great porter!

650 ml bottle at home. Black color withe beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, chocolate, cocoa, maple, spicy notes like cinnamon, caramel, licorice. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Full silky oily body with soft carbonation.

Pours a deep brownish black from the bottle with bubbly tan wispy head that dissipates slowly to leave good lace. Aroma of big smoky earth notes up front, boundless chocolate malts and roast, and a nice sweet back end. Taste follows, hint of booze at the end with a nice earthy smoke from the bacon, coffee over all of it. Thicker than you would think for a porter, but still not syrup, booze is present, but not over the top. Really nice.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2017 Tap. Moderate toasted cereal, dark bread, chocolate and hints of coffee for the malt, light pine forrest for the hops, light dough and earth for the yeast, with maple syrup, wood, burnt, and cola in the background. Head is small, frothy, light brown, with good lacing and good legs, and is mostly diminishing. Color is very dark brown. Flavor starts moderately to heavily sweet and lightly acidic, then the long finish is moderately bittersweet. Palate is full, syrupy with a soft carbonation and a lightly astringent and sticky finish. This is a top notch Imperial Porter, maybe one or two "off" aspects that keeps it from being perfect, but the woods-y characteristics is what I enjoyed most about it.
Maple, bacon, chocolate, and just all around goodness. ItÂ’s a bit sweet so I couldnÂ’t drink loads of it. But itÂ’s great to have a small glass of it.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting, my place. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, chocolate, coffee, maple syrup, caramel and hops. Nice bitter finish.

Bottle, 9.5%. Black with medium brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, espresso and dark chocolate. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, espresso, dark chocolate, sweet, liquorice, hop and medium bitter.

Bottle @ Saxo tasting. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, heavy coffee and dark sugar. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily and soft. 301216

Bottle @ Johns. Pours very black with a light brown head, light lacings. Aroma of sweet roasted malt, caramel, coffee, marple sirup, expresso. Flavor is sweet, rich malty, caramel, loads of coffee, marple sirup, expresso. Medium body, soft carbonation, sweet finish with a bit of alcohol. 301216

Dark brown color with mocha head. Aroma has really nice sweet coffee notes and light maple. Taste follows with the sweet coffee but more roasty and bitter. Medium body, really smooth. Overall itÂ’s slightly better than MBCP but not mind blowing.
Bottle @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours black with a creamy beige head and lacings. Roast, mocha, vanilla, maple syrup. Sweet chocolate. Extremely smooth and soft. Really tasty!

Aroma of maple syrup, vanilla, pancakes, coffee, chocolate. Taste of maple syrup, coffee, chocolate, fake vanilla, waffles, caramel, slight artifical lean to it. Thick viscous mouthfeel, no real signs of abv, very sweet, but also quite drinkable.

At the whales tasting at TomÂ’s. Headless murky brown. Lots of coffee, grade B maple syrup, some chocolate covered cranberries in the nose. Tastes woodsy and sweet, with notes of cocoa and grade B maple syrup. Full-bodied, no carbonation, a little coffee finish.

Bottled. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of coffee, syrup, trace of smoke among with woody notes. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and with a hint of bitterness and a little salt. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A excellent Porter. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

Bottle. Pours almost black with off-white head. Aroma of maple syrup, round coffee, hint of cocoa, very nice. Taste of sweet maple syrup and the bitterness of coffee balance the sweetness very good. Hint of alcohol. Long weak finish of dry wood/bitter almonds.

Bottle @ Mikkeller Ã…rhus Popup shop. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of coffee and subtle smokey notes, good coffee, lots of maple and toffee, quite chewy caramel, quite a lot of liquorice, a strong sense of alcohol. Taste is heavy sweet, with loads of coffee and liquorice, loads of toffee blended with a huge amount of maple syrup, slight salty, quite bitter wooden taste. Good stuff.

Funky Buddha Wide Awake ItÂ’s Morning
W aromacie czekolada, kawa, sÅ‚odycz, wanilia. Smak sÅ‚odki, w smaku syrop klonowy, karmel, czekolada, nuta palona. Super.
Maple Bacon Coffee Porter na sterydach. Jeszcze wiÄ™cej ciaÅ‚a, fantastyczna kawa, genialny, sÅ‚odki finisz, duÅ¼o syropu klonowego. Meeega.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Panel #6 Rami Rami is drinking a Wide Awake ItÂ’s Morning by Funky Buddha Brewery at Chmielarnia MarszaÅ‚kowskaMega kawa i troche reszty czekoladowo bekonowo smazonej. Fajne cialo, to juz piwo, bo porter to ufoOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Bomber shared by Bvery, thanks so much for sharing this! Aroma is coffee, maple syrup. Taste is bitter coffee up from then comes the sweetness, some slight smoke. This is amazing!
UPDATED: DEC 11, 2016 Bomber from Eric - thank you sir! Jesus, this is out of this world! Rich maple syrup, vanilla, coffee, slight smokey meat. Dammit, incredible!

Bottle at home. Black body with a small offwhite head. Chocolate, cocoa powder, maple syrup, coffee, vanilla, light smokey notes. Whoa this is freakinÂ’ delicious. Soft, rich, round, so full of flavour, itÂ’s exploding in my mouth. So complex.

The aroma is full of chocolate, maple syrup, smoke, coffee, bacon and caramel. The color is dark brown, almost black. The taste is full of chocolate, maple syrup, smoke, coffee, bacon, roast, caramel, dark sugar, molasses, dates and plums. The finish is long and smokey. Really nice beer!

Large shared bottle.
Nicely sweet. Moderate complexity. Very good balance.
Rich flavor, with maple, chocolate, and coffee evident in the aroma and flavor, but no bacon. Excellent anyway, so good I donÂ’t miss bacon!

Overall: excellent!

Bottle 22oz.
Pours black with medium-high brown head. Good lacing. Aroma is of coffee-crisp, chocolate, roasted malt. Taste is of coffee-crisp, roasted malt, chocolate. Palate: Full bodied, soft-medium carbonation. Overall: Artificial, but quite good. You have to like bold ones.

Bottle sample at "whales" tasting, thanks DSG. Opaque black with a beige head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, cocoa and caramel. Sweet, coffee, maple, caramel, chocolate, cookies, finish is bitter and warming. Medium-full bodied, oily and sticky. Great.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Tom LÂ’s place. Thanks PDXAmbassador for this bottle! Black with some light brown foam. Great aroma full of coffee, chocolate, milkshake, mild smokiness, light maple note, woody note. Sweet flavor with lots of coffee,roast, light sourish hint, chocolate, milkshake, lots of maple, some smokiness, and a finish with some bitterness and maple. Full-bodied, rounded. Wonderful.

Coffee liquor, chocolate, vanilla, smoked hints. Maple, roasted sourness. Dark chocolate, thick liquid, smoked notes in the back. Savory.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At the whale tasting, TomÂ’s Place, Pours black with a beige head, aroma of chocolate, coffee, cocoa, vanilla, moka, chocolate milkshake, fruity, flavor of coffee, maple, green coffee, chilli, caramel, cocoa, coconut, slightly smokey, wood, brandy, full bodied, amazing

Dark almost black pour with a dark beige head. The armona has smoked malts and maple sirup, loads of coffee and cake spices. Really great. The taste has maple sweetness up front and develops towards a coffeeish and chocolate middle and ends with slightly bitter licorice or dark chocolate. The maple is pressent throughput. The texture is light and somewhat creamy with a soft carbonation. Very pleasant stuff for sure!

Bottle. Insane aroma of maple syrup, pancakes, coffee, smoke / bacon, light toasty malt. 
Pours pitch black with a creamy and dense beige head. 
Taste follows the aroma with a great transition from the sweeter maple syrup to smoky bacon and then lightly roasted coffee. Morning dessert in a glass. 
Lower side of full bodied, silky mouthfeel, soft carbonation, coffee finish. 
This is awesome.

Bottle shared at deansoÂ’s thanks to RandomStrangerNL! Pours almost black with a light brown head. Heavy on the chocolate and coffee, maple syrup sweetness, roasted coffee beans, light smoke. Not getting the bacon notes but the smokey and salty notes really round out this beer. Full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Medium sweet, over medium bitter.

Bottle shared at deansoÂ’s. Thick brown pour with a tan head. Tons of maple syrup, light smoke, roasted malts, caramel, cinnamon, coffee, espresso. ThereÂ’s got to be some salt in there, really enhancing all the flavours. Medium to full body, medium to low carbonation and a very nice sweet finish. Out of this world, thanks for sharing, RandomStrangerNL!

Sampled from bottle at deansoÂ’s. Black with tan head. Big sweet roasted chocolate malts, maple syrup. Big ass. Charcoal. Coffee. Bitter. Sweet. More coffee. Boom! Medium sweet, big roasty bitter. About medium bitter. Big fuck

Bottle shared thanks to RandomstrangerNL. Black with light brown head. Huge coffee, maple syrup, deep roasted malts, quite some smoke, dark chocolate, roasted nuts, lots of bitter coffee and herbs. Medium sweet and quite bitter. Full bodied with quite some carbonation. Bit too bitter.

Style et rÃ©sumÃ©: Imperial porter aromatisÃ©. 
Comment: DÃ©gustation Manseau Automne 2016, Merci Tommy et les autres.
Portrait:  Une biÃ¨re brune avec une mousse beige. Un nez de chocolat, de cafÃ©, de bourbon, de Coffee Crisp. CÂ’est envahissant comme odeur. La texture est superbe. Les saveurs sont intenses de cafÃ©, de chocolat au lait et de barre de chocolat Coffee Crisp. Succulent mais un peu chimique. 
Note:  8+/10

A Coffee Crisp (TM) filled the room as soon as it was opened. Pours a good black with a light beige head that leaves good lacing. Nose is certainly of Coffee Crisp, err, hazelnut essence and chocolate I mean! Taste is moderately sweet and loaded with chocolate, coffee, malle syrup, charred malt and alcohol. Body is medium, carbonation moderate. Sticky. Oh so fake but still a lot of fun!

Pitch black, tan head. Aroma of vanilla, coffee, caramel, maple syrup and bourbon. Sweet flavour, vanilla, brown sugar and loads of coffee. Quite thick. Finish coffee, vanilla, bourbon. Nice!(from 66cL bottle @ The Jersey Thursday Tasting, jtclockworkÂ’s home, New Jersey. Thanks for sharing todayÂ’s beers, Jersey crew!!)

Bouteille 650ml, bottle share. Couleur noire opaque, mousse moka foncÃ©e laissant un anneau sur les parois du verre. ArÃ´me de coffee crisp, cafÃ©, soupÃ§on dÂ’alcool, soupÃ§on de fumÃ©e. GoÃ»t de coffee crisp, malt torrÃ©fiÃ©, chocolat au lait, sucrÃ©e. Carbonatation moyenne-faible, corps moyen-dense.

Bottle (22 oz), shared. Pitch black with a small brown head leaving little lacing. Aroma is intensely coffee crisp forward with maple syrup, caramel, cofffee, vanilla and a bit of alcohol. Taste is sweet with loads of maple syrup, coffee, vanilla, coffee crisp, chocolate and mild fruitiness. Medium to full body. Moderate carbonation. Coffey crisp finish. Good in very small pours. Too intense, artificial. Very coffee crisp forward.

bottle at tomÂ’s epic tasting 2016. pours hazy dark brown with a small light beige cap offering some retention and lacing. roasted pecans, loads of maple syrup, chocolate nibs, spices, vanilla - french toast, pain residual sugars. moderately low carbonation, medium to full body; sweet and creamy vanilla-maple finish. comforting yet artificial - a fine escort.

CrÃªpes au sirop dÂ’Ã©rable, cafÃ©, friandise chocolatÃ©e, gaufrettes caramÃ©lisÃ©es, amertume en fin de bouche. Corps moyen et texture crÃ©meuse. Superbe. Ã‰tonnamment facile Ã  boire. JÂ’aime beaucoup ce genre de truc qui tombe, pour plusieurs, dans lÂ’exagÃ©ration.

Bouteille. Robe noire opaque avec de minces reflets noisettes et avec un lÃ©ger col de mousse beige. ArÃ´mes de chocolat, biscuit Papineau, crÃ¨me fraÃ®che. Simple mais "rentre dedans". En bouche, mÃ©lange de cafÃ© et chocolat noir onctueux, bois sec, sucre dÂ’Ã©rable, lÃ©ger fumÃ©. Finale lÃ©gÃ¨rement amÃ¨re de cacao et cafÃ© moulu avec touche caramÃ©lisÃ©e. Texture soyeuse et lisse, corps plutÃ´t rond.

2 ounces at tasting. Aroma: intense chocolate, coffee crisp, light maple. App: dark brown, little lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, medium high sweetness, subtle bitter finish. Overall: this is my kind of beer. Lots of adjuncts in this beer but I donÂ’t care. This is really good. Enjoyed this a lot. Well made.

Thnx to Mike !!! Pours black, small grey head. Smell is very pure, intense maple syrup , some coffee, bit sweet. Tatse is full, very roasty, thick, sweet, maple syrup.. Very very full mouthfeel, low carbo. Extremely nice !

Bottle thanks to Greg. It poured a dark brown to black color with a tan head. The aroma was of toffee, toast and some bread. The taste was similar to the aroma with more toffee, toast, bread, some maple a touch of bacon and caramel. It had a bitter and a dark malty finish. Mighty tasty.
Smells like coffee. Lots of maple. Vanilla. A lot of coffee. Thick. I need pancakes. Thx markwise.

Sampled at DoranÂ’s. Thanks Gregwilsonstl. Black with a tan head. This smells awesome. Coffee, chocolate, and maple. Rich and big. The flavor is also a wow. Only a small tick behind the aroma. The Awesome-O-Meter is pegging. Everything in the aroma is tasted and it works so well. Cinnamon spice and light sugar with more brown sugar. Awesome stuff!

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle and my first perfect beer! Poured into a snifter showing thin rims of coffee, pitch black center, and a finger of latte colored foam. 

The nose is an intense mix of maple and coffee that blends together to form equally intense notes of milk chocolate, french vanilla, cappuccino with a light bacon undertone becoming more apparent upon warming up. I could go on forever, but each note deceptively changes into another as the beer warms. 

The palate is fully and smoothly carbonated with a light foamy body - the perfect airy porter mouth feel. Flavors of the same on the palate. Moderately intense vanilla showing constantly throughout on the background ending on a lightly sweet yet cappuccino/latte bitterness with the vanilla and coffee seeming to go on forever on the linger.

IÂ’ve been wanting this beer since I first learned of it upon its release. 

Dark body, near black, medium viscosity, small collar. The aroma is where this beer begins to take off. Oh my. Chocolate, vanilla, smores, breakfast sausage, maple. The flavor is also top notch, following the aroma. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Complex and absolutely delicious.

Bottle split with a friend. This is one intense beer. ThereÂ’s so much flavor going on that itÂ’s hard not to be equally overwhelmed and impressed. The dominant flavor is coffee, which hits halfway through with a bitterness that lingers, but thereÂ’s also a good amount of chocolate malt sweetness that makes it taste like a coffee stout. As it warmed up the maple syrup really came out, although I never really noticed much bacon flavor except for a bit of smokiness. This is one mad, beautiful creation.

How: Bottle.
Where: Sweet & Sour 2016.
Appearance: Black colour with a small beige head.
Aroma: Chocolate, roasted malt, maple syrup, dried fruit, coffee.
Body: Full body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, caramel, alcohol, some bourbon.

Bottle at north vs south tasting. Poured a dark black colour with a light tanned head. Nose of dark espresso coffee, smoke, dark malts, molasses, maple syrup, vanilla Cream, mocha. Taste is sweet chocolate, syrup, dark coffee, bitter, light bacon. Light sweet but intense bitter finish.

Tallahassee, Fl - on tap at Proof. Motor oil black pour, mocha colored head that dissipates quickly. Delectable, sinful, aroma of maple syrup and bittersweet chocolate. Delicious flavor, very similar to Boston Cream Pie, maple syrup, a brief tinge of smoked meat, but not much. Thick, rich mouthfeel. Like any prescription, good in small doses, a full pint of this would have been too much.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2016 A: Deep dark brown with a light brown head that leaves a thin lacing. N: Maple syrup, coffee, caramel T: Deep espresso, maple syrup, hint of liqourice O: Very heavy on the coffee and maple syrup! Very nice as well!

August 20, 2016. Bottle at Sweet & Sour. Thanks for sharing! 
Black with a small creamy brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty and light roasted with maple syrup, caramel, vanilla, milk chocolate, dark roasted coffee, hints of sweet licorice, touch of dried fruits.

Taste is sweet, malty and soft roasted. Finish is smooth, sweet caramel, maple syrup, vanilla, bitter roasted coffee and chocolate notes. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation. 
Great, smooth and drinkable.

Bottle at Sweet & Sour 2016 at Sahtipaja, SÃ¤tila. Opaque black beer with a nice beige head. Chocolate and licorice aroma, maple syrup, chocolate, coffee notes, figs, raisins, some cocoa. Licorice flavor, maple syrup, caramel, coffee, raisins, warming alcohol, ice coffee, dark chocolate notes. Great beer.

Bottle courtesy of Biggsbowler. Pours blackish dark brown with a small frothy mocha head that doesnÂ’t leave much trace on the glass while dissiapting. Smell is malrty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, espresso coffee, dark chocolate, caramlized bacon, maple syrup, moist soil, sweet liquorice candy and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter and malty. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny viscous, tiny astringent and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with roasted malts, heavy dark roast coffee, chocolate, maple syrup, burnt wood and hints of alcohol. While I wouldnÂ’t have minded a fatter mouthfeel this is still just so damn decadently good. Intense espresso and maple. Lovely!

Tried at Himmeriget in Copenhagen.
This beer is a true coffee stout with notes of chocolates. It got a great full body and the alcohol is kept well under control.

Bottle share on 7/30/16. This immediately followed the Maple Bacon Coffee Porter, what a combo. If the MCBP was the jab that knocked me silly, this was the knockout blow. Everything that MCBP was, this had dialed up, with the added booziness from the 10% ABV. This isnÂ’t breakfast the morning after, this is breakfast while youÂ’re still out partying.
22oz bottle pours out black topped with a small tan head. Nose is big maple syrup sweetness coffee and roast malts. Taste is more of the big maple syrup sweetness rich malts and coffee

black with brown edges Smells like a coffee milkshake with marshmallow added. the middle to ending is just so effing loaded up with coffee itÂ’s ridiculous. no bacon (if there is any?) but a ton of coffee. at first you just get this fudge bomb. how is that floridians are making good porters? itÂ’s not sane at all.
Bottle shared at RBSG. The beer is a dark brown with no head. Aroma has coffee, chocolate, toffee, and maple. Sweet and roasty. Big body and medium carbonation. Thick mouthfeel.

Bottle from jtclockwork-thanks, James! Pours dark and thick as youÂ’d expect. Nose is massive maple syrup and not much else. Taste starts with massive maple syrup followed by a bitter roasted coffee, finishing sweet with more maple syrup. Not sure I get the bacon, but there is a smokiness to it. Very rich and hard to finish. More maple syrup than IÂ’ve ever had from a beer but ultimately too much and somewhat disjointed.
Bottle - Coffee, maple syrup and some roast. Jet black with a light brown head. Coffee, maple sweetness and a long rich finish. Wonderful.

Bottle shared by a friend. Darkest brown pour with a medium tan head. Aroma of maple, vanilla, chocolate and bacon. Malty and caramelly flavor with maple and slight bacon before a chocolate and roast finish.

Bottle at RBSG PGH 2016, big thanks to Beerman6686! Good strong beer from the start. Big black coffee color. Has a very good coffee attitude without any of the ill effects that are so common in most coffee beers. Would never know this is 10% because of the smooth well made black coffee attitude. Half way through I start to get some smooth chocolate in there as well. IÂ’m not usually a fan for anything imperial, but I found this to be quite enjoyable, thanks Dan!
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle at RBSG PGH 2016. Clear brown color. Aroma of briwnies dipped in coffee. Taste is coffee and cocoa, sweet maple. Nice.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2016 Bomber from AK. Thick, syrupy and jet black and limited tan head. Aroma wafts through the room. Maple syrupy sweetness in the nose. Roasty and burnt with the maple syrup sweet profile. Very hearty with bitter chocolate bite. This is a meal best shared and enjoyed with friends. There is a cloying aftertaste from the coffee that makes this not as too notch as others have rated it.  Alcohol also becomes noticeable as this warms.

32 oz. crowler from Homer321 - huge thanks, Sean! Pours a deep, hazy dark brown color with a moderate tan head that settles into a ring and little galaxy of film while leaving spots of lace in the glass. Loads of the main features here - maple, brown sugar, and coffee, in particular, with backing smoke, vanilla, cocoa, and tobacco. Medium-plus bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sticky, mildly roasty mouthfeel. Like the recent experience I had with ManBearPig, this one needs its own glass for the evening or everything else is going to smell like it going forward. And like other Funky Buddha crazy beers, it absolutely delivers on what it promises. Fun stuff.

Bottle shared.
No head. Clear black pour. Lots of coffee and maple syrup. Very good.

22 (I think). Thanks, R! What an awesome hookup. Pours an opaque matte black with a dense and creamy burnt tan head that settles fairly quickly to a think film. Intense coffee nose, sweetness is dialed back, smokiness is in the foreground but nowhere near as pounding as the coffee. Creamy thick body with moderate carb. Coffee, a little smoke, more coffee, a little sweet, more coffee. Coffee finish. Very intensely flavorful beer but they sure do hold it together.

Long time want. Thanks Dan for sharing. Pours a deep dark brown black with a brown head. Big aromas of maple with smoke and huge coffee. DoesnÂ’t seem artificial and the bigger beer definitely takes the adjuncts well. ItÂ’s a sweet beer for sure but oh so drinkable.

Poured a dark brown with a beige head. Aroma was of big maple, smoke, coffee and fudge. Very inviting. Flavor similar, much more of a real beer than mbcp which comes off as artificial. Would love to drink this all day.
Bottle shared thanks to Dan. Poured dark brown with light beige head. Aroma sweet maple roasty coffee. Light carb med bod. Taste malty cereal maple coffee. Good
I hate to give gimmick beers their due but this one wins. Tons of great flavors, all balanced at the stronger version

Bottle, new batch, shared by James on 6/10/16.Deep ebony, of indeterminable clarity with a tan head atop that is large and shows moderately strong-to-strong retention.After the disaster that was French Vanilla Militia (and most imperial stouts these days, it seems), I was not exactly chomping at the bit to try this, but what a pleasant surprise....dark chocolate combines with maple-like earthy-sweetness (that doesnÂ’t make much sense, I know) and a ton of raisins and vanilla to give a strong aroma but the dark chocolate-like roastiness is ever-present keeping the caramel, raisin, fudge and such from becoming too dominant. Coffee notes are pretty reserved and itÂ’s not a mass of burnt, black, sharp french roast, thankfully. Fruitiness reminds of the best English-style Imperial stouts and there is no sign of the alcohol, in the nose.Even better, is the flavor, with prune, raisin and creme brulee balancing chocolate, light roast coffee and vanilla-tinged caramel. The flavors are all highly enjoyable and while itÂ’s pretty sweet and fairly thick, both the tight carbonation and fair amount of attenuation coupled with the fruity acidity, make for a surprisingly balanced beer. On the finish of every sip, just as the fudge and caramel is about to take over, the raisin, prune and roasted barley notes dry things out considerably adding a bright zip to the end. No alcohol noted. Very happily finished my glass and then some. Easy drinking.

22 oz bottle. Shared with DCLawyer and my friend Tyler. From a trade with markwise, cheers Mark! Dark brownish black with tan head. Aromas of maple syrupl, dark chocolate. Tastes of maple syrup, dark chocolate, subtle smoke. Medium-full body with a dry finish.

Bomber->tulip shared by GenDV110+OT. Thanks Donnie! Deep brown with small tan head. A: deep coffee and chocolate, maple, molasses. Awesome. T: maple syrup and mocha, molasses, slightly bittersweet malt. Fantastic.

#2000. What a journey thus far. Bottle shared in the hotel by ebone1988 for his 1.1k and my 2k rating. The pour is a thick black oily color with a thin film of darker khaki head and no lace to be found. The aroma is excellent. There is a lot of maple and an excellent chocolate. There isnÂ’t a whole lot of coffee, but IÂ’m definitely getting the chocolate and maple. This one should be damn good. The flavor is really chocolatey and mapley up front. There is a resounding bacon aspect to this that just moves in and dominates for a while. Nice roast, good bitterness. ItÂ’s got a sweetness on the back on the a decently bitter roast. The mouth feel is lighter tha. I wanted. Medium to heavy body with a nice soft carbonation and a lingeringly bacon-influenced aftertaste. There is a bitter chocolate malt and coffee trying to poke through, but itÂ’s controlled by the bacon. This is a good beer, and I definitely appreciate Eric helping me get to this milestone. Thanks man!

#1100. Bottle courtesy of Jordan. Thanks! Bottle shared with koleminer20 for his #2000 on Ratebeer. Aroma is unbelievable, maple, coffee, chocolate, booze, maybe slight bacon, wow. Appearance is black, light brown head, poured thick. Taste is lovely, sweet maple, bacon, chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, booze, a lot of things happening to make this one complex. Mouthfeel is heavy body, light carbonation, booze, maple, and bacon in the aftertaste. Overall, this is a real great beer.

Bottle from a trade. Poured right after drinking a regular MBCP. Nice dark pour with a dark colored head. Nice maple nose. Nice smokey flavor with a lot of maple flavors. Really good. Not quite the regular.

Crowler from homer321. Pours black with minimal head. Aroma is incredible. Maple syrup, coffee. Really awesome. Taste is sweet up front, some cocoa and tons of coffee. Finishes very bitter. Aroma and first sip are incredible but too much bitter coffee as I sip my way through this.

Crowler thanks to Homer! Pours black with a light brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a great maple note with a light smoke, some bitter coffee, sweet dark grains and a bit of roasted malts. Flavor has a much more bitter coffee note with some sweet dark grains and a bit of maple underlying.

Pours dark brown, near black. Two finger brown head fades to spotty lacing. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, hint of smoke, light char, light maple. Taste is more bitter than I expected. Coffee and chocolate are in nice harmony but a bit forward. The maple and smoke are pretty faint here. Not quite as sweet as the regular version....still, the alcohol is well hidden. Finishes fairly bitter and coffee forward. Solid beer but not quite as good as I expected. Lofty expectations set by Morning Wood? Perhaps.
23oz bottle pours a thick dark brown color with a bit of head. Sweet maple aroma. Strong coffee flavor giving lots of bitterness. The maple and hops seem to clash a little.

Very dark brown - almost opaque, and light beige lacing. Strong maple aroma along with coffee, powdered cocoa, and some toasted malt. Rather sweet at first but becomes more a bit more bitter. Smooth and creamy despite having only a medium body. Moderate carb and a pleasant black coffee finish.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 32 oz. Crowler shared by Willrunforbeer, dude, many accolades. Nose is a sweet maple syrup, lasting chocolate. Pretty decent amount of coffee. 
Taste is awfully sweet. Coffee with creamer, chocolate, and mild nuances of vanilla. Finishes bitter and sweet with lingering sticky maple syrup texture. I am left searching for the "bacon" or sweet smoke notes that would imply meat. Body is fuller but not quite "stout" like. Honestly, still a wonderful stout but I think I prefer the original Porter version. I will not be a overly critical snob.

"Big Ass Can" 32oz crowler sent by Homer321. Big thanks, Sean! So excited to try this! Pours nearly black with a beige head. IÂ’m sitting a foot and a half from my glass, and I can already tell that this smells amazing. Going in for a closer sniff... This does smell amazing! ItÂ’s breakfast. Bacon, dark chocolate, dark coffee, maple. I felt like the regular Maple Bacon Coffee Porter fell a bit short of the aroma, and this does too, but not as much. Dark chocolate, dark coffee and maple. A touch of smoke at the finish. Flavors are pure and natural.

Poured from crowler thanks Willrunforbeer brown black pour nice lacing with a thin mocha head. Aromas of fresh coffee maple syrup mild smoke butterscotch. Taste is malty sweetness coffee maple hint of smoke dark fruit. Amazing aroma needs more bacon!

Bottle thanks to Grant. Pours a very dark brown with medium beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong maple syrup, coffee bean, chocolate. Thick mouth, maple, roast, coffee bean, chocolate, nice booze, really enjoyed this one.

Pours black with a thin tan head that fades fast. Sparse lacing. Nose is sweet like sniffing a breakfast of pancakes drenched in warm pure maple syrup, with a side of bacon. The taste is sweet at first, but followed quickly by a wave of bitterness, like chewing an espresso bean. Full bodied brew with mild carbonation. Excellent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUN 22, 2016 Bottle -Pours black tan head - nose/taste of cinnamon, sweet maple bacon, coffee, roast chocolate - full bodied

Growler. Pours black with no head. Pours black with no head. Aroma of sweet flavored coffee - almost like an ice coffee. Weak smoke, fudge, toffee, butterscotch and vanilla. The coffee is really dominating and delicious. The taste has that some fresh and sweeter smelling coffee with other nuances of weak tobacco, chocolate, toffee, vanilla and a slight smokey end. This is something to really enjoy and that will give most people a wow-experience. Atleast I had one!
Draught at Himmeriget. Pitch black - offwhite head. Spicy. Sweet malty. Cake. Peppery. Wooden. Dry wooden. High malty. Thick body. Nice - but a bit too crazy.

Tap @Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Pitch black pour with a dark tan head. Nose has tons of maple, sweet syrup and some light smoke. Taste is smooth with tons of maple syrup, fleshy smoked meat, light subtle coffee and some. A bit sweet and intense but I like it!

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2016 Growler from Bill. Thanks a lot, buddy! 

Pours pitch black with a small fizzy dark brown head.

Aroma is packed with maple syrup, woody notes, nutty, caramel, sweet chocolate, nutty, just a subtle smoke along with roasted malts, toffee, fudge, dark fruits. Wow.

Taste backs it all up; roasty, loooots of maple syrup, malty, ice coffee, subtle smoke, tobacco, dark fruits, caramel, fudge, roasty bitterness.

Although flat from the trip in the growler this was awesome! Would love to revisit sometime; hopefully not flat.

Draft. A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, prunes, maple sirup, coffee, over ripe fruit, and alcohol. TBE flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, prunes, chocolate, ash, over ripe fruits,, maple sirup, and coffee, and alcohol, leading to a dry roasted finish.

Keg. Black with a medium sized good lacing dark brown head. Strong coffee and syrup in the nose with some chocolate too. Kahlua. Full body, really thick texture with soft carbonation. Lots of coffee. Maple syrup, dark chocolate, kahlua, dark dried fruits, dark bread. Warming alcohol. Slightly sticky and rough on the alcohol. Sticky alcoholic finish. Lots of punch, too much for me.

Roasted and sweet malty aroma and taste with some caramel and maple syrup sweetness, cocoa, nuances of dark fruit, brown sugar, velvet mouthfeel, gorgeous stuff.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From tap. Pours dark brown to black with a brown and creamy head. Aroma is toffee, toasted and breadish. Maple and bacon clearly comes through. Sweet, toffee, caramelish and toasted malt. Bitter and dark malty finish.

Draught at Himmeriget.
Black colored with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of caramel and dried fruits with notes of burnt sugar.
Sweet and roasted flavor of caramel and dried fruits and burnt sugar.
Roasted finish.

Tap Pitch black colour with small beige head.Aroma is sweet of syrup and coffee mild smoked,feels strong vinious and smooth,mild salty with cocoa flavor aswell,full body and hint of cinnamon and vanilla also really nice.

Pour pitch black, with a solid khaki one finger sized head. 
Aroma truly is imperial bacon maple coffee porter. A lot More maple, vanilla, roasted coffee, slightly salty smokyness, milk chocolate, slight coco powder. Taste is somewhat sweet up front, with a rather bitter middle and out. Pretty darn Well balanced. 
Semi medium bodied, with the perfect amount of semi flat carb. This is pretty complex, and really evolves on the palate. Great stuff.

This was one of the first Funky Buddha beers IÂ’ve ever had which was lucky and quite amazing. Smells like a maple, bacon, coffee pancakes. Dark color that tastes like you are eating one of those pancakes. It hits the palate perfectly as it doesnÂ’t taste 10.5%. Overall one of my favorite beers that I hope to have a third and fourth time in the future. Cheers!

Keg at Cask Pub & Kitchen on 8.12.15. Pours black with thin tan head. Aroma of French toast, dried fruits, chocolate and maple syrup. Looks fabulous. Taste is coffee and chocolate with the maple coming through with a hint of bacon and a little booze. So smooth and velvety. Just a fantastically good beer.

Keg at CP&K, 07/12/15.
Rich black with a dirty tan head.
Nose is full on maple syrup, light coffee cake, tres sweet, toffee fudge, light spice, toasted brown sugar.
Taste comprises sweet maple syrup, tiramisu, sweet malt, molasses, chocolate fondue, espresso, melted Toblerone.
Full bodied, oily mouthfeel, sweet warming alcohol in the close. 
A decadent impy for sure but a touch overly sweet for me.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Keg at CPK - London. Pours oily black with a creamy tan head. Massive aroma, tons of maple syrup, hearty chocolate, mild roast, raisins, perhaps a hint of cinnamon. Big sweet flavorbwith lots of gooey chocolate, nicely integrated maple syrup, French toast, baking cocoa, mellow earthy bitterness, soft espresso. Full bodied, oily and chewy, with fine carbonation. Lightly warming finish with some sticky burnt sugars, buckets more maple syrup and liquefied chocolate, vanilla, hints of earth and dark fruits. A pretty awesome over-the-top American adjunct impy.

Keg at CPK. Black, small foamy brown head, light lacing. Aroma is really strong maple syrup, coffee, chocolate, molasses. ThereÂ’s definitely a strong maple Â’nÂ’ bacon vibe on the nose. Body is medium to full, smooth, soft carbonation, rounded. Taste is very sweet chocolate liqueur, pecan pie, rum, maple, some coffee. ItÂ’s a lot like a liquid version of those liqueur chocolates you give your grandad at Christmas. Well judged by comparison to most over-sweet dessert beers.

Keg at CP&K. It pours jet black with a decent tan head. The nose is rich, decadent, camp fire, big maple syrup character, bitter-sweet, rich coffee, coffee chocolate and maple-glazed doughnut. The taste is pretty full-on, rich, bitter-sweet, slick, oily, rich coffee, maple glazed bacon, smoke, charred wood, salted liquorice, warming alcohol, treacle, light curry leaf, burnt marshmallow and cacao nibs with a smooth, warming finish. Full bodied, fine carbonation and slick mouth-feel. Pretty bonkers stuff. Intense and good fun. A touch hot perhaps, but I like it.

On tap at BrÃ¼ Craft. Dark brown with some froth. Nose is coffee, light maple, molasses and mild smoke. Creamy, full-bodied with a tang. Taste is caramel, maple, smoke, faint bourbon and coffee. Lovely maple sweetness plays off the earthy coffee and woody bourbon. As good as expected.

Draft, Oakland Park. Near black. Aroma is syrupy sweet molasses, maple donut, bourbon...decadent. Very sweet, again maple doughnut frosting. Very thick body with a slightly boozy kick. Decadent. Not getting much bacon but thatÂ’s not a big deal. Moreish for such a beast. You can really see the appeal.

On-tap at the Funky BuddhaÂ’s 2nd Anniversary Party. Poured into an FB snifter. Black without being inky. Small khaki head. Wispy and a little sticky. Intense coffee without ever being acidic. It rounds itself out with a touch of maple and some smokiness that mellows the coffee into an earthiness that is quite pleasant. A little over the top at first, but the full nose is quite nice. Like the nose, the coffee taste is intense and almost astringent. The acidity of it is just a little too much at first. The roasted malts mellow it, surprisingly, and give it a nice touch of smoke in the end. The maple is barely a hint, if I can even detect it at all. It just seems to be there as something that keeps it drinkably sweet at such a high ABV and coffee content. The coffee intense and maybe a little too intense. The rest of the beer drinks nicely, especially for 11.5%, which is how FB listed it on the board. Medium bodied. Nicely balanced except for the coffee. A really nice beer without being exceptional in any way. The way the coffee character blends with the smoked malts is its best characteristic.

Pours thick dark unclear deep coffee dirty brown black with a small darker beige head and light lacing. Aroma and flavor are divine bringing a blend of coffee and beautiful maple syrup showcasing in the nose, better balanced maple than any other beer I have had! Flavors bring the maple and coffe balanced again with no overbearing flavors and then the bacon is quite subtle with some smokiness blending with coffee so well.
Draft. Black pour with tan head. Sweet maple, dark sweet malts, almost candy aromas. Dark chocolate, maple and sweet flavors.
Draft at the Buddha brewery - lots of coffees, slight smoke, chocolate and sweet maple in the nose. Taste is fudgy, chocolate, coffee. Some bitterness in the end. Very rich flavors.
Sample at Huna Day. Pours black with small head. Lots of coffee chocolate maple syrup sweetness, very rich and flavorfull.
Tap at huna day, aroma is toasted malt, sweet maple and light smoke? Bacon is still hard for me to pick up, solid brown ale
32 ounce crowler. Pours black with a light brown thick head. Aroma of maple, chocolate, and coffee. Taste is maple syrup, chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt. Rich and creamy. Deserves the attention.
Black pour. Amazing aroma of French toast and maple syrup, flavor of French toast, coffee, dark chocolate, dark fruit, hint of peppers. Body is full, sticky, and sweet.

Tasted from draft. Pours black with a nice mocha head with good lacing. Incredible aroma of coffee, maple syrup and cooking bacon. Smells like breakfast. Taste is coffee, maple syrup, caramel, toffee and a little chocolate. Full bodied and clingy to the palate. Absolutely incredible beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

32oz crowler. Thanks for ojgio for sharing this amazing beer at the kbs hotel bottle share. Dense black with nice amount of head for a stout. Huge coffee and slight chocolate on the aroma. Taste is a complete coffee bomb. Not as complex as the regular mbcp, the coffee really dominates in it. Thick and chewy body. As far as coffee stouts, this is behind only MD.

An Imperial Maple Bacon.. This beer has everything Maple Bacon has going for itself except it bit stronger... This beer is full of flavor leaving a thick lining on any glass you drink this from. Coffee, Smokey, Sweet This beer will modify your palate so have one of these last if you want to be able to taste the other beers you are drinking.

IÂ’ve had this a million times and have no idea why I havenÂ’t rated it. Had one yesterday at Kapow in Boca Raton. Draft. Pours a nice black oil with a mocha one finger head in a snifter. Aroma is the most fun part of this beer. From 2 feet away I could smell breakfast cooking. Coffee brewing, bacon frying, and maple syrup. As it gets closer to your nose it all comes together. The taste is also great. You really get the 3 elements of the MBC individually but they also balance nicely with each other. Moderate carb, medium to heavy body, medium mouth feel. Always a treat.

This is the one I came to try. Tap at MBCP release. Pours clear chestnut, medium creamy brown head that dissipates leaving nice lacing. Aroma is coffee chocolate mocha goodness with a strong overtone of maple syrup. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter, really really good. Medium body, somewhat creamy mouthfeel. Not to be missed.

Porsche dark brown with a medium light brown head. Aroma is maple syrup, coffee, and rich - almost chocolatey malts. Taste is very smooth & silky coffee going to rich roasted malts and finishing with maple syrup and coffee bitterness. This one is a true ride.
Draft at MBCP day. Nose is a ton of coffee and maple. Lots of maple. Did I mention maple. Coffee is moderately acidic and slightly too much roast. Still a very good beer.

[emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Fish tasting aka Haarlemmestraat tasting aka Elite tasting aka did Dean do something (stupid) today aka BenzaisÂ’ endless triangle travel aka ChrisÂ’ Birthday tasting:
Bottle: Served in a taster: 
Black beer with a thin brown head/lacing.
Aromas of coffee, pepper, dust, coffee beans, wood, hazlenut, earthy mocha, cacoa, espresso and a good touch of chocolate.
Flavours of roast, coffee beans, coffee roast, pepper, hazlenut, mocha, espresso, chocolate and wood.
Aftertaste of coffee, chocolate, mocha, wood and light pepper.
Low carbo, creamy thick silky mouthfeel, full body and a creamy thick light sticky texture.
Delicious stuff! Awesome!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle shared @ tasting. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized light brown head. Aroma is malts, huge dark roast, huge espresso, big dark chocolate. Taste malts, again huge roast, huge coffee, espresso, dark chocolate, bitter. Thick oily texture, full body, medium carbonation. Wow, super intense!

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2014 Bottle thanks to Countbeer. Black pour with almost no head. Aroma is so nice, rich milk chocolate, cinnamon, pepper, tons of espresso, vegetal espresso notes. Taste is rich, so decadent, great coffee flavors, milk chocolate, coconut, lovely caramel sweetness. Palate is full bodied, but not cloying. Really tasty.

Bottle shared by Kamiel with Chris, Julian, and I. Aroma of milk cocoa, coconut cream, marzipan, and other amazingness. Flavor is dark cocoa, Hershey, shaving coconut, and milk. Medium to fuller body. Awesome fucking stuff.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2016 Bottle shared big thanks to Countbeer. Pours very dark brown with a ring beige head. Aroma of huge maple covered pancakes, rich coffee beans, hazelnut, coconut, cocoa, toffee, fudge. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Excellent!
Awesome.  Black pour. Coffee. Chocolate. Coconut. Awesome. Sweet and decadent.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2015 Updated: tap at 2015 mbcp fest. Wow, theyÂ’ve improved this beer a ton. Huge maple, coffee on the nose. Taste is naple, fresh coffee, chocolate, so syrupy and smooth.
First rating: Tap at Funky BuddhaÂ’s 2nd year anniversary.  Black with brown hues along the edges--like black coffee. Nose is coffee, maple, booze, smoke. Taste is the same with a rough bitter finish. Okay mouthfeel, but could use a little more body.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2016 22 oz. bottle 36/50.  Pours a clear dark brown/cola color with a small tan head.  The nose has big maple and brown sugar with additional smoky malts, roast, coffee and light nuttiness.  The  flavor has the same big maple and brown sugar, roasted coffee, and some smoky malts.  There was a small amount of a lactose sourness going on with this which distracted a bit, but was overall pretty good.
Sampled at RBSG and I think this is better now. Flavors really pop.

Original batch, kindly poured by the man himself into a FB snifter

A: Pours a big syrupy black color with a small khaki colored head. Retention isnÂ’t great, but with a high ABV it still looks evil

S: Damn, tons of sweet maple, coffee, and some burnt bacon. Simply amazing. The maple adds a whole new dimension to this beer that I never thought was possible

T: Much more balanced and refined that I expected. The bacon is less noticeable in the flavor, but the maple adds a pleasant flavor and balances the dark roast coffee. Thick body and dangerously drinkable. Not too much hop presence, but then again, thatÂ’s not what you would want in a beer like this.

MF: Thick and chewy feel to it, sweet maple/coffee finish, low-medium carbonation. Alcohol is not detectable.

O: Overall, this is an amazing beer worthy of its hype. I have not had but one chance to get to FB since I am at school in SC since they have become a world-class brewery, but I will definitely make the effort now. Great job Funky Buddha!

Poured from a 22 oz. bottle into a snifter.  This bottle is about a year old.

Wide Awake pours a dark brown mahogany color with almost no head formation on the initial pour.

The aroma still jumps out of the glass.  Bursts of espresso, sweet maple syrup, smoke, and vanilla all come through.  With the age of the bottle I would not be surprised if the coffee smelled even better fresh, but it still smells incredible.  Each whiff unveils a little bit more complexity.  This is definitely a winner.

The flavor is huge.  There coffee flavor manifests itself in the beginning of the sip, with what seems to be a few different types of exquisite espresso.  Sweetness runs rampant with maple syrup flavors coming through during each part of the sip, with a little bit of vanilla as well.  A thorough smoked malt flavor comes through representing the bacon.  There is no concern of it being too smokey, a fear I often have with beers that use smoked malts.  What is truly amazing is how each sip provides a new angle on the combination of coffee, maple syrup, and smoke.  Each flavor develops more thoroughly with each sip, making this a glass that never gets boring.

Each sip is truly a full bodied treat.  It is so thick and viscous, with a light and creamy carbonation.  It is definitely sweet, sticky, and syrupy, and more than a little over the top.

This beer impressed me even more than the Maple Bacon Coffee Porter, which is saying something.  I would love to have a fresh bottle to compare.

Thanks a bunch for the rare tick Sean. This bottle is about a year old and itÂ’s held up incredibly. Pours a brownish black in color with almost no head formation. Nose is Maple Bacon Coffee Porter on steroids, the coffee, maple, and vanilla all pop quite a bit. There is some smoke character there as well. Flavor follows the nose only itÂ’s heavier on the maple syrup and bacon character. The maple syrup lingers nicely on the finish. Nice and smooth mouthfeel, not acrid at all from the coffee, no booze, almost silky. Great beer, Funky Buddha kills another beer. I loved the MBCP and this blows it out of the water.

Bomber from Funky Buddha.  Cheers, gents!  Pours a dark stout brown with an off-tan head.  Nose is chocolate, light maple, smoke, some ash, and some bacon.  Flavor is similar with chocolate, roasted malts, some smoke, some bacon, and some rubbery ash as well.  Body is medium to the bottom side of full, and lingering roast and smoke in the finish.  Really interesting beer.

Bottle with friends. Dark brown appearance with a light brown head. Roasty, dark chocolate, light smoky, rich maple, caramel, espresso aroma. Rich coffee, dark chocolate, light maple flavor with a touch of ashy smoke.

Bomber poured a clear dark reddish brown with a lingering ring of brown foam. Aromas of cocoa, maple, coffee, light smoke and light roastiness. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of cocoa, maple, smoke, coffee and light vanilla with a smooth dry lingeing cocoa finish.

Pour out of 22 oz bottle, big thanks to Bill for the pour.  Dark murky brownish black with thin tan head, aroma had big roasted and ashy notes, salty bacon and caramel came through, a bittering coffee as well with smoke lingering as well, with a nice sweet maple and honey coming through at the end.  CanÂ’t believe how close it smells like to the name. Taste was a bit ashy, but a nice full bodied mix of salty smoked meats, coffee and a nice sweet maple note throughout, made this a delicious and much more full version of its smaller counterpart.  Delicious stuff.

Sampled at EBF Saturday Afternoon. 
Pours a solid dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma is heavy on the coffee with maple, brown sugar, and hints of bacon. ThereÂ’s a beer in that glass? Taste is really quite the coffee bomb with hints of maple and brown sugar. Medium to thick body with a creamy oily mouthfeel and a moderate level of carbonation. While not horribly complex, it is different and I really enjoyed this beer.

Pouring at the Saturday afternoon session of EBF.  Pours a deep brown with a medium sized beige to tan head.  Big coffee, maple syrup and molasses.  Coffee syrup flavors come through right away, long maple backing it up.  Loads of sweetness, but still fairly drinkable.  Long roast with more syrup on the finish.  No smokiness ever showed up, but this was still delicious.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2012 WAIM pours a pitch, oily, black with very little head at all.  But letÂ’s just forget what this beer looks like because as youÂ’re pouring this beer your nostrils will be attacked with huge aromas.  One of the strongest beers IÂ’ve ever smelled in my life.  The aroma is full and I mean full of maple syrup.  When I mean full of it, itÂ’s hard to explain.  I could walk into the other room and still get a little bit of the smell.  Putting my nose up to it I got more.  A nice bit of smokiness comes up, followed by coffee, roasted malt, and chocolate.  ItÂ’s impressive.  ItÂ’s huge.  ItÂ’s hard to explain on a blog. 

The taste is just as good and just as big.  Once again the maple syrup dominates and I really wonder just how much they used for this beer.  The flavor is dominated by sweetness.  As the maple calms down a bit youÂ’ll pick up the other flavors.  Coffee, smokiness, and chocolate.  This beer is huge but the ingredients totally cover up any alcohol that is in this beer.  ItÂ’s breakfast in a bottle. ItÂ’s a total sipper.  One to sit back and enjoy over an hour or so.  I was questioning myself the whole time, is this really beer?  Awesome.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied, low carbonation, but very sticky.  Like maple syrup.

Thanks to John for sharing this awesome brew! Bottle 11 of 50. Pours dark brown with just a hint of tan head. The smell of this is like nothing else! Maple syrup, bacon, smoke, coffee, pancakes, reminds of a maple pecan doughnut also some tobacco notes. Taste: Coffee, smoke, maple syrup, pancakes, nuts, bacon and tobacco. Thick on the palate with a interesting maple bacon and coffee finish.

Bottle. Poured dark brown color with an average frothy light brown head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy chocolate and roasted coffee malt with a small alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy balanced roasted dark coffee flavor with a medium to heavy dark coffee sweet finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout beer.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2011 Bottle shared by Kan.. Pours black with no head, nose loads of ashy coffee chocolate hazelnut, fl hazelnut, kalouha, ashy, strong astringent booze, raisin, pretty terrible and undrinkable,
Pours almost black with a tan head.  Smells heavily vegetal, celery, and brussel sprouts.  A bit of acrid roast and coffee.  Maple flavor, roasted malt, coffee, and smoke.

BIG THANKS To darkguardian for this one!!!!!!!22oz bomber bottle number 6 of 50.  I was torn whether or not to open this bad boy right away or to sit on it for a special occasion.  After some comments I decided to open it last night.  Man am I glad I did.  The second I opened the bottle the maple syrup and coffee smell filled the room.  I was a little worried after all the hype that I was gonna get a bad bottle but the inital smell is all good.  I poured it into a darkness snifter and it poured black with some brown head that went away very fast.  The smell is of roasted coffee and maple with some smokeyness.  The taste is great alot smoother than I thought it was gonna be itÂ’s like breakfast in a beer.  Mouthfeel could be a little thicker in my opinion(if you wanna split hairs).  This beer was a little bittersweet because it was such an amazing beer and I wish I could have share it with someone, but IÂ’m also happy I got the whole bottle to myself (minus a couple sips for my wife).  After all was said and done my hands still reeked of maple syrup and my wife said my breath stank of dark coffee.  ALL AROUND AN AMAZING BEER!!!!  TOTALLY LIVED UP TO THE HYPE!!!!!!!

Bottle, thanks a lot to darkguardian for this beauty! No 1 beer in a tasting with a lot of world class brews. 
Pours pitch black with a small, brown head. Absolutely INSANE aroma ! 
Nose picks up freshly ground dark roast coffee (best coffee aroma IÂ’ve ever experienced in a beer), a bit of chili, crunchy burnt bacon, syrup, toasted bread. 
Taste of coffee, sweet maple syrup, dark, heavy roasted malt, chocolate. Full bodied, loooong finish, with all the different flavours lingering for a long time. 
A totally crazy beer that still somehow manages to be very balanced.
Easily one of the best beers IÂ’ve ever had. Love it. Need more!

(Bottle) Pours black with a brown head. The aroma holds super roasted aromatic coffee, red chilly pepper, gravel, parsley, burned pancakes, dark syrup, black chocolate cake, fancy smoked meat, dark bread, sweaty liquorice and wet asphalt. Far out, but really well balanced and super yummy. Aggressive, yet fancy. The flavour is near medium sweet, near medium bitter and tiny acidic. Tones of smoke, complex coffee character, maple syrup, dark fruits, dark chocolate, asphalt, salty/sweet liquorice, sweet currant candy and well-integrated hops. The mouthfeel is round, fat and oily with a light to medium carbonation (surprisingly vital). Liquorice, hops, coffee and light syrup on the finish. Full bodied. Fantastic, really fantastic!

Bottle #34 of 50, courtesy of thagr81us during the South Carolina tasting. Whalish figure.

This one pours a near lifeless black, medium IÂ’m body. Right off the bat you get hit in the face with aromas of maple syrup pancakes, smoked sausage, coffee, vanilla, and sweet chocolates. Crazy nose and very strong. You can smell it from ten feet away. The flavors are a nice mix of maple syrup drenched breakfast sausages, chocolate, vanilla beans, and light coffee. While very good, I may soon be Diabetic. The sugar is out of this world. ItÂ’s drinkable but only at maybe half a bottle at a time. I canÂ’t take that much sugar. Very nice beer though and definitely unique. To think that a beer can accomplish such a complex nose is mind boggling. Great beer and excellent beer to tick.

Thanks a ton John!  Pours black with a thin creamy head.  Smells of bacon, sausage, and pancakes with maple syrup...no kidding!  Smoke and sage sausage with a heavy roasted coffee also on the nose.  Very rich and rather heavy on the palate with a maple pancake and coffee and sausage flavor it.  This is absolutely mind blowing, they really nailed it.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 A: Dark black-brown body. Just a thin, but well defined, ring of khaki foam. Spotty sudsy lacing.

S: Maple syrup and burnt coffee. A bit of smoke and roast. Not particularly inviting or well developed.

T: Like the nose, coffee (both roasted and burnt) takes center stage. A bit of smoked malts, maple syrup, brown sugar, and chocolate.

M: Fairly thin for as much malt in the flavor. A weak, sloppy finish. Slightly over carbonated.

O: Eh, I just didnÂ’t get the appeal of this. I didnÂ’t get any bacon and the smoke and coffee were rather boring. Give me MikkellerÂ’s beer geek bacon anyday.

Funky Buddha wide awake itÂ’s morning. 22oz bottle numbered 45 of 50.  
Thanks to you know who... Pours an almost still soy saucy like pour with barely a resemblance of a head whatsoever... Aroma is full on maple then followed up with a light smoke and tootsie roll qualities ... Flavors are robust and assertive with big maple, coffee, and charred chocolate characteristics. Softer on the smokey side but a really big maple and brown sugar component. Medium to full bodied with a moderate level of carbonation. Smooth yet quite sweet to satisfy those with a sweet toothe.
8/3/8/4/17

Pours black with little to no head.  Aroma is amazing.  Maple, bacon, and coffee.  I donÂ’t know how they manage this one.  Buts its pretty damn amazing.  Medium mouthfeel.  Flavor is more maple, bacon, then finishes with coffee.  I kept smelling and tasting and smelling and tasting.  This is an amazing beer and worth seeking out.  Just awesome.

Bottle shared in Chicago with Kan and friends. Super strong maple aroma which I could smell across the room when the bottle was opened. Pitch black beer without much head. Quite thick and full in your mouth and quite smooth. Up front flavors of nuts, coffee, maple syrup, smoky malt and bacon. An unusual combo of flavors for a beer obviously but it works pretty well with sipping. Liked this original beer but not blown away.

HUGE thank you to Hopscotch for sending me this. Damn Son! What a beer. I am a fool for more experimental stuff, and this takes the cake. Best aroma in any beer that I have ever had. Maple, bacon, coffee, its all there. Smells like breakfast. I literally could smell this beer all damn day. Pours a deep brown with minimal lacing.  Taste is heavy and sweet, coats the palate with a viscous oily residue. Delicious. Simply delicious. I am in love. And, I NEED more.

Pours very dark with a very very slight head. Immediately the aromas hit you maple, coffee, some smokiness. The taste is rich and luxurious with slightly sweet flavors resembling the aromas, coffee, maple, smoky bacon. Absolutely delicious. The mouthfeel is amazing, it coats your mouth in velvety richness. I could literally find nothing wrong with this beer. I wish there were 10,000 bottles.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2011 Aroma of Nutty, toasted brown sugar, maple syrup, salty peanut butter.   Caramel, nut salty maple candy bar taste.toasted brown sugar candy bars and think salty peanut butter chocolate chip cookies.   Rich. A tad on the sweet side to be sure, but relatively drinkable.   Aroma> flavor.  Complex, but comes off as a bit muddled.   Interesting, peculiar, potent beer.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2011 22 oz bottle shared at KanÂ’s. Thanks! Pours a murky blackish brown hue, brownish lighter edges, with a small offwhite head, dies to a tiny ring. No real lacing. Aromas are a heavy roasty coffee, some cream, cocoa, heavy roast and espresso. Rich with some maple, cream, vanilla, and mocha. A lot going on here, with a heavy coffee dominance. Initial is medium bodied with a decadent mocha feel, coffee, roast. Lots of chocolate, hazelnuts, caramel, and maple. Touches of vanilla, with a good flavorful appeal. IÂ’d say the mocha and coffee are dominant.. Ya think? Cream, espresso, chocolate. Finish is powerful lingering mocha and espresso. I wouldnÂ’t say itÂ’s complex, itÂ’s just very powerful. Coffee fans (especially Dessert Coffee fans) should try this. ItÂ’s pretty rich. Special? No. But flavorful and interesting. Coffee grounds, mocha, some real lingering maple essence sticks around. Flavorful is the key here and strong it is, but much too sweet, lacking balance. Just kinda an "In your face" display here. Surprised at the scores.

thanks to hopscotch for this gem! wowee! the nose on this is intense and insane! hits you before you even know it, smelled this beast before i could even get the bottle to the glass, and i ddnt take it to my nose. huge amount of espresso like coffee, chocolate, smoke, huge and pungent. would liked to have seen more head. the taste is to match, though its pretty damn sweet. nearly to slightly cloying, thick and oily, this is like drinking coffee and bacon flavored maple syrup! yum! lol! excellent beer, has a quality similar to surly four with the intense extracted coffee profile, delicious stuff. zing! another good one from funky budddha, though i preferred the other two i had over this one due to drinkability.

Bottle 30/50...Big thanks to Casey for this... dark brown body with not much carbonation... the nose is outstanding, so much is going on, super strong notes of maple and roasted coffee, they play perfectly off each other... the taste is more refined than the nose, simply outstanding melding of maple and coffee, a bit of molasses, the maple is so sweet but the roasted bitterness of the coffee balances... I could drink about a half bottle of this, but would get too sweet after awhile... worth trying

Had on tap at the Buddha for the release of it.  Near pitch black color with a thin tan head.  The nose is huge.  Smoke, sweet maple and coffee all in there.  The taste starts off smokey and then is sweet with a good bit of maple then get roasty from the coffee.  The coffee lingers for a little while too.  Great full body mouth feel.  IÂ’m not a huge coffee fan but this is great stuff.  The guys at the Buddha continuing to put out top notch stuff.

Bottle thanks to my good friends at the Buddha.  WoW, what a freakinÂ’ nose!!!  Outrageously intense smoked maple and coffee aromas.  Joan Jett black pour with a small tan head.  Great balance and as complex as an Arthur Conan Doyle novel.  Bold roasted coffee flavors which quickly give way to intense maple, roasted malt, chocolate, and vanilla flavors.  I need to run this side by side with the original.  Just another stunner from Kevin, Ryan, and the Buddha crew.  BRAVO.......

On tap at the release (06-26-2011)

Beer pours pitch Black....what a gorgeous color.

Nose gives a lot more smoke then the regular Maple Bacon Coffee Porter, which was something that I could careless about as I do not enjoy smoke. In this beer though it fits in perfectly.

This beer is a GrandSlam Breakfast (minus the eggs) in a glass. Maple Syrup is present, Smoke is there, and SLAMMM a huge hit of Black Coffee! Everything is exceptionally well balanced.

The highlight of this beer is the mouthfeel. I have complained before that I wanted more mouthfeel from some of their beers. This one is spot on. Almost velvet-y smooth. Just Perfect!

Very Good Beer!

Been waiting for this one for months and it didnÂ’t disappoint one bit.  Black with a ultra thin tan head that disipates quickly.  The aroma is an intoxicating blend of sticky maple syrup and fresh brewed espresso with hints of bacon smoke, chocolate and figs.  Slick oily mouthfeel with light carbonation.  The flavor has everything the nose suggests and is extreamly drinkable for a 10.5 beer.  Great beer.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2015 DraftÂ… This beer rocks!Â… Pours black with a small, creamy, khaki head. The nose is all about pure, deep roast Cuban or Kona coffee accompanied by gobs of maple syrup and a subtle nuance of crispy, smoked bacon. Full-bodied with a velvety mouthfeel and modest carbonation. Huge Cuban espresso and maple syrup flavor without the cloying sweetness I feared may rear its ugly head when I first heard they would be Â“imperializingÂ” the Maple Bacon Coffee Porter. Balanced nicely by what I can only assume are black malt, singed coffee and hops. Burnt, acrid, moderately bitter, espresso finish. Way too drinkable for a high abv beer. I had three glasses and could have drank more. Another world class beer from Kevin and Ryan at The Buddha!

Draft at the Buddha. Long awaited, this lives up to the hype. Pours a pitch black, little head. Nose assaults you with waves of maple syrup, a little whiff of smoke and roasted malt and coffee. The body is huge yet this beer is so drinkable its scary. I chugged this pretty quick and had absolutely no problem doing so. Flavor wise there is alot of maple up front and the coffee dominates the back end with the roasted malt taking up the mid palate. Very layered, something I find in alot of the Buddha beers. There are a few things missing though. The smoke in the nose and in the original maple bacon is not here, it has been dominated by the coffee, which is the other issue. A tad to much coffee here. Such a well done beer, and knowing the guys at the Buddha they will continue to tweak this, and IÂ’ll probably have to change my rating. Another home run for the crew at Funky.

Been waiting for this gem of a beer for quite some time. Pours black, not too thick, but not thin either. Maple is the main ingredient that you smell first, swiftly followed by smokiness and coffee bean. A little bit more smokey then the regular Maple Bacon. The ABV is hidden very well amongst the flavors in this one. Has to be one of the best beers IÂ’ve ever had.
